com.github.methylene.sym

Class Permutation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.methylene.sym.Permutation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<Permutation>

    public final class Permutation
extends Object
implements Comparable<Permutation>

    A permutation that can be used to rearrange arrays.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Permutation(int[] posmap)
      Creates a new permutation from the given array.
      Permutation(int[] posmap, boolean validate)
      This constructor is for expert use only.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Permutation

        public Permutation(int[] posmap,
           boolean validate)
        This constructor is for expert use only.
        Parameters:
        posmap - posmap
        validate - expert setting: if false, skip a certain constructor sanity check, to save time if we're already sure that the input is valid

      • Permutation

        public Permutation(int[] posmap)
        Creates a new permutation from the given array.
        Parameters:
        posmap - a list of numbers that specifies the permutation in zero-based one-line notation. For example, posmap = new int[]{1, 2, 0} creates the permutation that sends new char[]{'a', 'b', 'c'} to new char[]{'c', 'a', 'b'}.

        Returns:

      • cycle

        public static Permutation cycle(int... cycle)
        Creates a new cycle. A single number n creates the identity of length n + 1. An emtpy input produces the permutation of length 0.
        Parameters:
        cycle - a list of distinct, non-negative numbers
        Returns:
        the cyclic permutation defined by cycle
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if cycle contains negative numbers or duplicates
        See Also:
        identity(int)

      • cycle1

        public static Permutation cycle1(int... cycle1based)
        Creates a new cycle.
        Parameters:
        cycle1based - a list of numbers that defines a permutation in 1-based cycle notation
        Returns:
        the cyclic permutation defined by cycle1based
        See Also:
        cycle(int...)

      • swap

        public static Permutation swap(int i,
               int j)
        Creates a new transposition.
        Parameters:
        i - a positive integer
        j - a positive integer
        Returns:
        the permutation of length Math.max(i, j) that swaps the elements at indexes i and j
        See Also:
        cycle(int...)

        Creates a random permutation of given length.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • identity

        public static Permutation identity(int length)
        Creates the identity permutation of given length.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of arrays that the resulting permutation can be applied to
        Returns:
        the identity permutation that can be applied to an array of length length
        See Also:
        isIdentity()

      • comp

        public Permutation comp(Permutation other)

        Permutation composition. The following is true for all numbers 0 <= i:

        
   this.apply(other.apply(i)) == this.comp(other).apply(i)

        If the other permutation is of a different length, padding will be applied to the shorter of the two permutations, to make the composition meaningful.

        Parameters:
        other - a permutation
        Returns:
        the product of this instance and other
        See Also:
        padding(int), prod(com.github.methylene.sym.Permutation...)

      • padding

        public Permutation padding(int targetLength)
        Create a permutation of greater or equal length. If n is a number such that this.length <= n, the following holds for all indexes 0 <= i < n: 
        
   this.padding(n).apply(i) == this.apply(i) // if i < this.length()
   this.padding(n).apply(i) == i // if i >= this.length()
        Parameters:
        targetLength - a number that is not smaller than this.length
        Returns:
        the padded permutation
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if targetLength is less than this.length

      • prod

        public static Permutation prod(Permutation... permutations)
        Take the product of the given permutations. If the input is empty, a permutation of length 0 is returned.
        Parameters:
        permutations - an array of permutations
        Returns:
        the product of the input
        See Also:
        comp(com.github.methylene.sym.Permutation)

      • prod

        public static Permutation prod(Iterable<Permutation> permutations)
        Take the product of the given permutations. If the input is empty, a permutation of length 0 is returned.
        Parameters:
        permutations - an iterable of permutations
        Returns:
        the product of the input
        See Also:
        comp(com.github.methylene.sym.Permutation)

      • pow

        public Permutation pow(int n)
        Raise this permutation to the nth power. If n is positive, the product 
        
   this.comp(this)[...]comp(this)
        (n times) is returned. If n is negative, the product 
        
   this.invert().comp(this.invert()) [...] comp(this.invert());
        (-n times) is returned. If n == 0, the identity permutation of length this.length is returned.
        Parameters:
        n - any integer
        Returns:
        the nth power of this permutation

      • invert

        public Permutation invert()

        Inverts this permutation. The following always returns true:

        
   this.comp(this.inverse).isIdentity();
        Returns:
        the inverse of this permutation
        See Also:
        comp(com.github.methylene.sym.Permutation), isIdentity()

      • move

        public static Permutation move(int delete,
               int insert)
        Creates a cycle that acts as a delete followed by an insert. Examples: 
        
   Permutation.move(0, 2).apply("12345");
   => 23145
   
        
   Permutation.move(3, 1).apply("12345");
   => 14235
        If delete == insert, the identity of length delete + 1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        delete - a non-negative integer
        insert - a non-negative integer
        Returns:
        a permutation of length Math.max(delete, insert) + 1
        See Also:
        cycle(int...)

      • orbitLength

        public int orbitLength(int i)
        Calculate the number of times this must be applied to given index until it is in its original position again, also know as the orbit length of the index.
        Parameters:
        i - a non negative number which is less than this.length()
        Returns:
        the length of the orbit of i
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if i < 0 or i >= this.length
        See Also:
        orbit(int, int)

      • orbit

        public int[] orbit(int i)

        Calculate the orbit of given index. The orbit is an array of distinct integers that contains all indexes

        
   i, apply(i), apply(apply(i)), ...

        The orbit always contains at least one element, that is the start index i itself.

        Parameters:
        i - a non negative number which is less than this.length()
        Returns:
        the orbit of i
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if i < 0 or i >= this.length.

      • order

        public int order()

        Calculate the order of this permutation. The order is the smallest positive number n such that

        
   this.pow(n).isIdentity();
        Returns:
        the order of this permutation
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if pos < 0 or pos >= this.length
        See Also:
        isIdentity(), pow(int)

      • isCycle

        public boolean isCycle()

        Determine whether this permutation has at most one than one nontrivial orbit.

        Returns:
        true if this permutation is a cycle
        See Also:
        toCycles(), cycle(int...), orbit(int, int)

      • toCycles

        public List<Permutation> toCycles()

        Write this permutation as a product of cycles.

        For every permutation p in the returned list, the following are true:

        
   p.isCycle() == true;
   p.isIdentity() == false;
        Returns:
        a cycle decomposition of this permutation
        See Also:
        cycle(int...), isCycle()

      • toTranspositions

        public List<Permutation> toTranspositions()
        Write this permutation as a product of transpositions.
        Returns:
        a decomposition of this permutation into transpositions
        See Also:
        prod(com.github.methylene.sym.Permutation...), swap(int, int)

      • signature

        public int signature()
        Calculate the signature of this permutation.
        Returns:
        1 if this permutation can be written as an even number of transpositions, -1 otherwise
        See Also:
        swap(int, int), toTranspositions()

      • reverse

        public static Permutation reverse(int length)

        Returns a permutation that reverses its input. Example:

        
   Permutation.reverse(5).apply("12345");
   => 54321
        Parameters:
        length - a non negative number
        Returns:
        a permutation that reverses an array of length length

      • isReverse

        public boolean isReverse()
        Determine whether this permutation reverses its input.
        Returns:
        true if this permutation reverses or "flips" its input
        See Also:
        reverse(int)

      • isIdentity

        public boolean isIdentity()

        Determine whether this permutation performs any rearrangement of its input.

        Returns:
        true if this is an identity permutation

      • length

        public int length()
        Get the length an array must have in order for this permutation to rearrange its elements.
        Returns:
        the length of this permutation

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Convert this permutation to a human readable string. This representation may change in the future.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a String representation of this permutation.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object other)
        Equality test. In order for permutations to be equal, they must have the same length, and their effects on indexes and arrays must be identical.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        other - another object
        Returns:
        true if the other object is an equivalent permutation

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Permutation other)
        Standard java comparison, compatible with equals in the sense that permutations compare as 0 if and only they are equal.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<Permutation>
        Parameters:
        other - a permutation, not necessarily of the same length
        Returns:
        the result of lexicographic comparison of this.posmap and other.posmap
        See Also:
        equals(java.lang.Object)

      • getPosmap

        public int[] getPosmap()
        Get a copy of the internal representation of this permutation.
        Returns:
        A copy of the index map that represents this permutation.

      • apply

        public int apply(int i)
        Move an index. The following is true for arrays a of any type and of length a.length == this.length, and all indexes 0 <= i < a.length: 
           apply(a)[apply(i)] == a[i];
        If the input is greater than or equal to this.length(), then the same number is returned.
        Parameters:
        i - a non negative number
        Returns:
        the moved index
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the input is negative

      • apply

        public Object[] apply(Object[] input)
        Rearrange an array. Each element of the return value of this method can be safely cast to the element type of the input.
        Parameters:
        input - an array of length this.length()
        Returns:
        the result of applying this permutation to input
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if input.length < this.length()
        See Also:
        apply(int)

        Returns:

      • apply

        public String apply(String s)
        Rearrange a string. More precisely, rearrange the array that is returned from String.getChars(char[], int).
        Parameters:
        s - an string of length this.length()
        Returns:
        the result of applying this permutation to s
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if s.length() < this.length()
        See Also:
        apply(int)

      • apply

        public <E> List<E> apply(List<E> input)
        Rearrange a list.
        Parameters:
        input - a list that has exactly this.length() elements
        Returns:
        the result of applying this permutation to input
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if input does not have exactly this.length() elements
        See Also:
        apply(int)

        public String[] apply()
        Rearrange the array that is obtained by calling 
        
   Util.symbols(this.length());
        Returns:

        See Also:
